Pre-Game Insights: Alperen Sengun and the Houston Rockets will host Luka Doncic and the Dallas Mavericks in Western Conference play.
The Rockets are 6-1 against opponents in the Southwest Division.
Houston averages 113.0 points while outscoring opponents by 6.4 points per game.
The Mavericks are 14-11 against Western Conference opponents.
Dallas scores 117.1 points while outscoring opponents by 5.6 points per game.
The Rockets are shooting 44.3% from the field this season, 0.9 percentage points lower than the 45.2% the Mavericks allow to opponents.
The Mavericks average 10.5 more points per game (117.1) than the Rockets allow their opponents to score (106.6).
Sengun is shooting 49.1% and averaging 18.9 points for the Rockets.
Doncic is averaging 28.1 points, 8.3 rebounds, 7.8 assists and two steals for the Mavericks.

In their last 10 games, the Rockets are 6-4, averaging 109.8 points, 48.8 rebounds, 22.0 assists, 7.2 steals and 5.7 blocks per game while shooting 44.8% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 105.8 points per game.

In their last 10 games, the Mavericks are 5-5, averaging 113.1 points, 42.7 rebounds, 23.1 assists, 8.5 steals and 6.5 blocks per game while shooting 46.9% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 112.2 points.
Rockets' injuries: Jae'Sean Tate (day to day, illness), Tari Eason (day to day, rest).
Mavericks' injuries: Kyrie Irving (out, shoulder), Dante Exum (out, wrist), Luka Doncic (out, calf), Dereck Lively II (out, hip), Klay Thompson (out, illness).
